intro: Patersonia occidentalis var. latifolia, commonly known as the broad-leaved Paterson's curse, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is a member of the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its broad, hairy leaves and distinctive blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and along roadsides, preferring well-drained soils. It is an annual herb that produces small, capsule-like fruits containing numerous seeds. Due to its invasive nature, it is often considered a weed in agricultural and natural environments.
